-e ---

Kartvelian languages belong to the Eurasian superfamily :

Kartvelian languages belong to the Caucasian loanword sphere

Kartvelian belong to CHG which contributed 50% to Yamnaya ancestry and is today linked to PIE languages.

Georgian Pronouns

| Person |Suffix | Kartvelian | Dependent | Cognates
|----------------|-------|---------------|---------------|---------------
1st s. |𓇋 I |me | 𓅱 |I,je,ich,we,wo,𓅱,me,my
2nd s.m. |𓎡 c |shen |𓏏𓍢 thə |thou,tu,Du,Dein,Sie,Seine Hoheit,sen
2nd s.f. |𓏏 th |shen |𓏏𓈖 th.n |ta,tien,Deine
3rd s.m. |𓆑 phs |es |𓇓𓍢 su |phs,son,sein,su,es,is,his
3rd s.f. |𓋴 s |es,eg |𓋴,Γ |she, sie, es (soft Γamma as gym)
1st p. |𓈖𓏪 νn |chven |𓈖𓏤𓏤𓏤 νn |nu𓍢,nous,uns,on
2nd p. |𓏏𓈖𓏪 tνn|tkven |𓏏𓈖𓏤𓏤𓏤 t'n𓏤𓏤𓏤 |ton,thine
3rd p. |𓋴𓈖𓏪 sνn |eseni |𓋴𓈖𓏤𓏤𓏤 s'n𓏤𓏤𓏤 |semn⋍them (their)

note the second person 𓏏𓎡𓈖𓏪 tkven!
This perfectly capsules the alternating Egyptian orthography between 𓏏&𓎡 t&k 𐌶𐍅&𐌲𐌵!!
𐌹𐌶𐍅𐌰𐍂 𐌹𐌲𐌵𐌰𐍂 >Euch,Euer

𓏏𓍿 as th/c is forgivably cose to 'sh'

reading 𓈖 as νn : ν greek is n latin (victor⇔niktor) also 𓈖 is the genetive *gvn: von

Numbers

1) ert-i erste first 𓌠
2) zur-i zweite second 𓌟 ⇔ keras
3) sam-i 𓐍𓂸𓏏 Ϣomte@COPT 三 sān 𐎘𐎍𐎘 ⇔ Shamash
4) woitxw fourth 𓏃 𒈾
5) (wo)xuid (五wǔ)𓂧𓇋𓏏 1+𓏃=𓏅 ?
6) `ekvs-i sechse 𓋴𓇋𓋴 sis hexa
7) svid-i seven siebente 𓋴𓆑𓎛𓅱
8) ara achte eight 𓎛(𓏠𓈖𓅱) 八bānara 𓃹𓏌𓊖=𓏤𓏤𓏤𓏤𓏤𓏤𓏤𓏤𓏌𓊖
9) pcxar-a 𓊪𓋴𓆓? பத்து-1 ?
10) vit-i ? 𓎆𓏏 ?
100) aSir ⇔ Asur

compare 4,5 with
семь ("syem")
восемь ("vo-syem")
Old double system: x, wo+x = one±x

Kartvelian has some connections to Anatolian and Turk languages.
Kartvelian has very remote Eurasian connections to Tamil numbers :

1 one (onnu) ஒன்று one
2 two (இendu) இரண்டு second / ir 儿 二 èr
3 three (moonu) மூன்று man 𓐍𓏠 (3rd person) 3 moons ☾☾☾ Ϣomte some 𒐗vs𒈫 門门thir vs door鬥
4 four (naalu) நான்கு ? 𒈾𓈖 naul 八 bānara=8 2*4 𓏌 𓊖 arba
5 five (anJu) ஐந்து panj 𓂬 (5) vs 𓂧𓇋𓏏 (5)
6 six (Aaru) ஆறு ?
7 seven (yElu) ஏழு ?
8 eight (ettu) எட்டு octo
9 nine (onbathun) ஒன்பது 1 to 10 / 1 不 10 / 1 + 8 八bā
10 ten (pathun) பத்து 𓊪thun ten 𓎆𓏏 ⇔ vit-i 𓂘 pfoten / 10 Zehen 𓍿

9 + 10 pair :
девять dyev-yat
десять dyes-yat
